meanings.definition: To calm or soothe (someone or a situation)
meanings.sent1: She was pacifying her crying baby by gently rocking him to sleep.
meanings.sent2: The music had a pacifying effect on the anxious dog, helping him relax.
meanings.sent3: The pacifying sound of raindrops on the roof made her want to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: His soothing voice was like a pacifying balm on her troubled mind.
meanings.sent5: The warm cup of tea was a pacifying gesture after a long day.

meanings.sent1: The mediation session aimed at pacifying the conflicting parties and finding common ground.
meanings.sent2: The serene view of the sunset over the ocean was pacifying to her soul.
meanings.sent3: The gentle breeze blowing through the trees had a pacifying effect on the park visitors.
meanings.sent4: Her presence alone seemed to pacify the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The peaceful melody of the flute was pacifying to all who listened.

meanings.sent1: He tried to pacify his upset friend by offering a sincere apology.
meanings.sent2: The manager pacified the angry customer by offering a full refund.
meanings.sent3: The cat pacified its hunger by devouring the bowl of food in seconds.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was enough to pacify any doubts he had about the decision.
meanings.sent5: The gift was meant to pacify her after the argument they had.

meanings.definition: To make someone less angry or hostile
meanings.sent1: His calm demeanor helped pacify the irate customer who stormed into the store.
meanings.sent2: She tried to pacify her brother's anger by explaining the situation calmly.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told managed to pacify her annoyance at his tardiness.
meanings.sent4: The apology was sincere enough to pacify her hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: The kind gesture was enough to pacify his friend's frustration.
